paper_abstract: We study the effect of the interference between two independent non-Markovian reservoirs on the non-Markovianity of a two-level system. We find that the interference can enhance the nonMarkovianity of the system. The additive master equation (ME) is invalid even if only one of the two reservoirs is non-Markovian, while it is a good approximation when all reservoirs are Markovian. We also derive the two states uniqueness for a two-level system coupled to structured reservoirs which maximize the measure of non-Markovianity defined by Breuer et al. [Phys. Rev. Lett. 103 (2009) 210401].
paper_title: Enhancement of non-Markovianity by interference of two reservoirs
